django.contrib.staticfiles.handlers
===================================

.. py:module:: django.contrib.staticfiles.handlers


Classes
-------

.. autoapisummary::

   django.contrib.staticfiles.handlers.StaticFilesHandlerMixin
   django.contrib.staticfiles.handlers.StaticFilesHandler
   django.contrib.staticfiles.handlers.ASGIStaticFilesHandler


Module Contents
---------------

.. py:class:: StaticFilesHandlerMixin

   Common methods used by WSGI and ASGI handlers.


   .. py:attribute:: handles_files
      :value: True



   .. py:method:: load_middleware()


   .. py:method:: get_base_url()


   .. py:method:: file_path(url)

      Return the relative path to the media file on disk for the given URL.



   .. py:method:: serve(request)

      Serve the request path.



   .. py:method:: get_response(request)


   .. py:method:: get_response_async(request)
      :async:



.. py:class:: StaticFilesHandler(application)

   Bases: :py:obj:`StaticFilesHandlerMixin`, :py:obj:`django.core.handlers.wsgi.WSGIHandler`


   WSGI middleware that intercepts calls to the static files directory, as
   defined by the STATIC_URL setting, and serves those files.


   .. py:attribute:: application


   .. py:attribute:: base_url


.. py:class:: ASGIStaticFilesHandler(application)

   Bases: :py:obj:`StaticFilesHandlerMixin`, :py:obj:`django.core.handlers.asgi.ASGIHandler`


   ASGI application which wraps another and intercepts requests for static
   files, passing them off to Django's static file serving.


   .. py:attribute:: application


   .. py:attribute:: base_url


   .. py:method:: get_response_async(request)
      :async:


      Asynchronous version of get_response.

      Funneling everything, including WSGI, into a single async
      get_response() is too slow. Avoid the context switch by using
      a separate async response path.
